basic_info.description: I'm an undergraduate Cognitive Systems student at UBC, exploring computer science, data science, and psychology. This interdisciplinary approach has deepened my understanding of AI, human-computer interaction, and UX design. Beyond academics, I'm a curious and passionate individual who loves learning and a video game enthusiast fascinated by what makes digital worlds so engaging.

projects.title: Spellrise
projects.subTitle: UBC Game dev Club
projects.description: I contributed to a mobile adventure game with the UBC Game Dev Club, working alongside a team of around 15 people. In this project, players cast spells by drawing on the screen as they explore a fantasy world. As a systems programmer, I implemented day-night cycles, developed in-editor tools to streamline the development process, and designed player-environment and player-enemy interactions. Additionally, I created a modular spell system that enabled non-programmer developers to create new features without coding, allowing for rapid prototyping and enhanced gameplay variety.
imageAlt: Gif showcasing the game, including a mobile screen spell drawing feature

projects.title: Crime Rate Analysis in Vancouver
projects.subTitle: Statistics class project
projects.description: Analysis of Vancouver crime data to see if there was any noticeable impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the crime rate in each neighbourhood of the city. For this project, we used R and Jupyter Notebooks to optimize datasets, wrangle data, make data analysis workflows, conduct statistical analysis and create visualizations.
imageAlt: Screenshot of the project files, including graphs of the data

projects.title: Environmental Psychology Research
projects.subTitle: Environmental Psychology course
projects.description: I was part of a group of six researchers conducting a study on the impact of video game-themed messaging on consumer behavior. This research was conducted in partnership with the UBC SEEDS program with the goal of finding methods of reducing post-consumer food waste in the UBC dining halls. Our study was conducted over two weeks on UBC Open Kitchen, where over 2000 observations were collected in conjunction with quantitative data around food waste and foot traffic in the dining hall. Afterwards, data analysis was performed using R, where the data was cleaned, wrangled, and analyzed using Whitney-Mann U and Wilcoxon tests. Lastly, a report followed by a presentation was conducted for our client, providing recommendations for the future. I worked in study and graphic design, data collection and analysis, report and paper writing, and performed the project presentation for the clients.
imageAlt: One of the posters used for the project, depicting Pacman with food waste reduction related messaging

projects.title: Tower Defense Project
projects.subTitle: UBC Game Dev Club
projects.description: I led a team of ten developers to create a tower defense game using Unreal Engine, C++, Blueprints, and Perforce. As the programmer and team lead, I translated abstract design goals into clear, actionable tasks for a team of varying experience levels, fostering a smooth development process. I focused on developing key features such as game logic, enemy wave creation, grid system, towers, UI, and in-editor tools for prototyping and testing. In addition to my programming duties, I contributed to game design and team management, ensuring smooth development and cohesive gameplay.
imageAlt: A screenshot of the game, showcasing different towers, enemies, and projectiles

projects.title: ML Agent Training
projects.subTitle: Cognitive Systems Design class project
projects.description: For our final project in the Cognitive Systems Design and Analysis class, teams of three to four students were assigned to develop and train a machine learning agent using Unity and C#. Leveraging my prior experience with Unity, I took on the role of the project's lead developer, agent designer, and reward architect. I implemented all observation capabilities for the agent and established the training specifications. Our efforts resulted in a third-place ranking in the class competition, which encompassed students from all class sections with over 200 students.
imageAlt: A gif of the agent training

projects.title: Pomodoro Timer
projects.subTitle: Software Construction class project
projects.description: For my first software project, I tackled the final assignment in a Software Construction class. Using Java, I applied object-oriented programming skills and design patterns to develop an app that enhances the Pomodoro study technique. The app allows users to track, record, and plan focus sessions efficiently. I adopted test-driven development with JUnit to ensure code reliability and robustness, achieving 100% code coverage on non UI methods. Additionally, I followed best practices and extensively documented the code to simplify inspection and maintenance.
imageAlt: A picture of the app main page, including different study session options, the timer, etc.

projects.title: Real Time Strategy Game
projects.subTitle: In development
projects.description: I am working as a programmer for the UBC Game Dev Club on a 2D Isometric RTS game built with Unity and C#. So far, I have worked on grid, navigation, and building systems.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio
projects.subTitle: You are on it!
projects.description: Crafted as a centralized hub to showcase my previous projects and refine my abilities for future human-computer interaction classes and potential job prospects. Constructed with Node, React, and SCSS, this platform serves as a dynamic space for skill enhancement and professional growth.
imageAlt: A screenshot of the landing page of this website

projects.title: Housing Management System
projects.subTitle: Databases class project
projects.description: For our final assignment in a database class, we developed a project mimicking a simplified residence management system. Our goal was to create software capable of simulating real-life scenarios by tracking tenants, mail, staff, rooms, buildings, and available rental equipment. My primary focus was on Java GUI development and database design, encompassing tasks such as creating an ER diagram, normalization, and schema creation.
